sen.j: かき揚げ（かきあげ）は、魚介類や野菜などを数種類組み合わせ、衣とともに揚げた天ぷらの一種。
sen.e: Kakiage is a kind of tenpura (Japanese deep-fried dish) that deep-fries several kinds of seafood and vegetables with deep fry batter.
Kakiage is a kind of tenpura, a Japanese deep-fried dish, where several kinds of seafood and vegetables are deep-fried in batter.
Kakiage is a kind of tenpura, a Japanese deep-fried dish, where several kinds of seafood and vegetables are deep-fried in batter.

sen.j: 蕎麦やうどんに載せたり、丼物種（天丼、掻き揚げ丼）として食べる。
sen.e: It is served on top of Soba (buckwheat noodle) and Udon (noodle) or as varieties of donburimono (bowl of rice with food on top) (tendon (tempura rice bowl) and kakiage-don (deep-fried diced shrimp and vegetables over rice)).

It is served on top of soba (buckwheat noodles) and udon (wide white noodles) or added to donburimono (a bowl of rice with food on top) such as tendon (tempura rice bowl) and kakiage-don (deep-fried diced shrimp and vegetables over rice).

It is served on top of soba (buckwheat noodles) and udon (wide white noodles) or added to donburimono (a bowl of rice with food on top) such as tendon (tenpura rice bowl) and kakiage-don (deep-fried diced shrimp and vegetables over rice).

sen.j: 東京で掻き揚げと言えばシバエビ、小柱（バカガイの閉殻筋）、ミツバをごま油で揚げたものを指すが、具材の組み合わせは多種多様である。
sen.e: Kakiage in Tokyo indicates a mixture of shiba shrimp, pillaret (adductor of a surf clam), and mitsuba (Japanese honewort) deep-fired with sesame oil, but the combinations of its ingredients range widely.
Kakiage in Tokyo indicates a mixture of shiba shrimp, pillaret (adductor of a surf clam), and mitsuba (Japanese honewort) deep-fried with sesame oil, but the combination of ingredients vary widely.
Kakiage in Tokyo indicates a mixture of shiba shrimp, pillaret (adductor of a surf clam), and mitsuba (Japanese honewort) deep-fried with sesame oil, but the combination of ingredients vary widely.

sen.j: - サクラエビ、イカの短冊切り、シラウオ
sen.e: - Sakura shrimp, rectangle cut of squid, a Japanese icefish.
